title: Sarong, 19th century
medium:
Meidum: silk, cotton, metallic threads
Technique: plain weave with continuous supplementary weft patterning
description: Two breadths of cotton joined in center. Black center area showing a fine red stripe running through. On either side is a wide border woven in yellow, black, and gold in a geometric (patola-inspired) design.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sarong, 19th century.Meidum: silk, cotton, metallic threads
Technique: plain weave with continuous supplementary weft patterning. 1961-115-16.
